articles.title: Who won the WSL transfer window? Rate each club's deals
articles.summary: BBC Sport pundits Steph Houghton, Ellen White, Karen Bardsley and Jen Beattie rate each WSL club's transfer window - and you can too.

articles.title: Premier League Darts 2026: Pundits predict best starters, dark horses, and winners
articles.summary: Ahead of the Premier League Darts 2026, we asked Sky Sports' pundits for their big predictions for the tournament...

articles.title: Chelsea adopt Match of the Day tactic to stop Arsenal set-piece threat
articles.summary: Despite losing their Carabao Cup semi-final, Chelsea attempted a new way of stopping Arsenal set-pieces - just days after a similar suggestion on Match of the Day.

articles.title: 'Playing with fire' catches up with 10-man Hearts - McInnes
articles.summary: Head coach Derek McInnes concedes that Premiership leaders Hearts were punished for "playing with fire" as a third red card in five matches contributes to a 1-0 defeat at St Mirren.

articles.title: Has the January transfer window always felt flat?
articles.summary: With just seven Premier League deals done on transfer deadline day, has the winter transfer window become a damp squib?

articles.title: 'Stronger, quicker, better, smarter than everyone'
articles.summary: Rory Smith and Chris Sutton analyse Arsenal’s dominant 4-0 win over Leeds United, explaining why the Gunners look destined for Premier League glory.

articles.title: Just seven signings - the Premier League's quiet deadline day
articles.summary: A low-key transfer deadline day ended with the fewest Premier League deals completed in a winter window. BBC Sport looks at the spending that was done, and examines why there was so little activity.

articles.title: 'Grumpy' Guardiola jokes about Man City spending
articles.summary: Pep Guardiola mischievously said he is "a little bit sad and upset" that Manchester City have only the seventh highest net spend on transfers in the Premier League over the last five years.

articles.title: Palace criticised for 'messing' with McNeil mental health
articles.summary: Dwight McNeil's partner criticises Crystal Palace for "messing" with his mental health after the collapse of his transfer from Everton.

articles.title: Celtic's O'Neill 'very interested' in Oxlade-Chamberlain
articles.summary: Celtic manager Martin O'Neill says he would be "very interested" in signing free agent Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain, but reckons the former Liverpool and Arsenal midfielder has lots of options.

articles.title: Tonali 'very happy' at Newcastle amid Arsenal links
articles.summary: Manager Eddie Howe says Sandro Tonali is "very happy" at Newcastle United after the midfielder was linked with a move to Arsenal.

articles.title: Arsenal sign goalkeeper Votikova on loan
articles.summary: Arsenal have signed goalkeeper Barbora Votikova on loan for the rest of the 2025-26 season from Slavia Prague.

articles.title: Football Daily
articles.summary: Kelly Cates reviews Tuesday's League Cup semi-final action.

articles.title: West Ham sell Denton for club record fee to Bay FC
articles.summary: West Ham sell defender Anouk Denton for a club record fee of £200,000 to American side Bay FC.

articles.title: 'Things happened quickly' - Bartley on Livi job
articles.summary: New Livingston manager Marvin Bartley only found out on Sunday morning he would be replacing David Martindale, hours before the club announced the change.

highlights.title: Premier League highlights this week - Week Highlights

articles.title: Championship transfer window winners and losers
articles.summary: BBC Sport looks at the teams who have emerged from the winter window looking stronger and those with question marks over the likely direction of their season.

articles.title: Talbi rocket seals decisive Sunderland win over Burnley
articles.summary: Watch highlights as Sunderland earn a decisive victory over struggling Burnley, capped by an incredible long-range goal from Chemsdine Talbi.
